intro: Oenothera trichocalyx, commonly known as the silverleaf evening primrose, is a species of flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage and showy yellow flowers that bloom in the evening. The plant belongs to the Onagraceae family and is known for its milky sap, which contains various bioactive compounds. Oenothera trichocalyx typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both ecological studies and horticultural cultivation.
